events.name: Google IO17 Extended Makerere
events.description: Google I/O is three days of technical sessions, hands-on demos, Google experts inspirational talks, hands-on learning, and a chance to hear more about Google's latest developer products happening live in Amphitheatre San Francisco from 17th -19th May. GDG Makerere is joining the rest of the World in organizing an extended viewing party in watching live as Google unveils their latest technologies.

events.name: GDG DevFest Uganda 2017
events.description:
On the 30th of September 2017, GDG Uganda, a collaboration among seven (7) GDGs in the North, West and Central Uganda including GDG Kampala, GDG Makerere, GDG MUBS (Makerere University Business School), GDG UCU (Uganda Christian University), GDG SLAU (St. Lawrence University), GDG Gulu University and GDG Mbarara will bring together up to 400 techies, entrepreneurs, policy makers and industry players for the Annual DevFest event. 

Register here to attend.

DevFest Uganda 2017 will have different activities from speaker sessions, Codelabs, speaker sessions, startup Fireside chats and a Hackathon.

GDG DevFest 2017 is aimed at equipping attendees with different skills (both technical and business) required for them to compete in the industry and also run successful companies.

We shall also present opportunities available for organisations, companies to improve their businesses and developers who are interested in using Google platforms to develop software.

Audience: 

Organisations, companies and institutions, Developers, Entrepreneurs, University students, Policy makers and Government. 

As part of the DevFest, we shall also host a Firebase AppFest bringing together 100 developers, where they will build an app in a day using Firebase and Cloud Functions. Join the AppFest.

events.name: Android Study Jam III

venue.name: College of Computing and Information Technology

events.description:
GDG Makerere is launching the third edition of the Android Study Jam, a free Android training series within Makerere university for new developers with the aim of introducing them to Android Fundamentals for beginners as well as share new Android tools for the experienced developers.

Join us every Wednesday from 4th of October to 1st November 2017, for 5 weeks and 3 hours for each meetup at Makerere University at the College of Computing and Information Sciences (CoCIS).

Register here to confirm your participation Android Study Jam III by GDG Makerere

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Makerere

venue.name: College of Computing and Information Technology

events.description:
• What we'll do
We are proud to be hosting the Google Cloud Study Jams. On the 24th of February 2018, GDG Makerere University shall launch Cloud Study Jams, a free Google Cloud Platform training series within GDG Makerere for new developers with the aim of introducing them to Cloud Fundamentals curriculum for the beginners and share the new Google Cloud Tools for the experienced developers. This will bring together about 50 participants and will run for 2 weeks and 3 hours for each meetup.

• What to bring
Bring your laptop, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
Bring your laptop charger.
The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

• Important to know
Participation is Free!
There will be reward For Participants who participant the Cloud Study Jam until the end.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam II

venue.name: College of Computing and Information Technology

events.description:
• What we'll do
Did you miss the first Edition of the GDG Cloud Study Jam? Join us for the second edition of Cloud Study Jam II on the 3rd March 2018 from 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM.

Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees will:
1) Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
2) Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
3) Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
4) Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud Computing.

• What to bring
Laptop, pen and a notebook.

• Important to know
This event is FREE to attend.
events.how_to_find_us: Level 5, Block B at CoCIS, Makerere Innovation and Incubation Center

events.name: IWD Makerere 2018
events.description:
IWD Makerere will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, enthusiasts, and technology entrepreneurs. We aim to encourage more women and girls within and around our community to be apart of the Women Techmakers Community and also recognize and showcase tech works and initiatives by female founders.
As Women Techmakers powered by Google Developer Groups, we plan to do this by improving our girl and women empowerment programs and members participation through increased collaboration and raising awareness through diversity and inclusion

• What to bring
Notebooks, Pens, Laptops

• Important to know
Event is Free

events.name: Cloud Study Jam with Kafeero Foundation

venue.name: Plot 7755
venue.address_1: Nyangweso road off Kironde Road, Tankhill road - Muyenga

events.description:
• What we'll do
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

- How long does it take?
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

- What is the end result?
Attendees will:
1) Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
2) Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
3) Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
4) Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud Computing.

• What to bring
Laptop, pen and a notebook.

• Important to know
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.
This event is FREE to attend

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018 - Flutter
events.description:
Details:

I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning and a first look at Google’s latest developer products. As part of the Google I/O Extended month, we shall focus on Flutter.

Flutter is Google's mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

What to bring
Laptops and Notebooks

The event is Free! However, register here https://goo.gl/M7mzjy after reserving your slot on this meetup website.

events.name: I/O 2018 Extended Makerere
events.description:
• What we'll do
GDG Makerere is hosting a Google I/O Extended party on Saturday 26th May, that will brings together software developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, students and tech enthusiasts. For activities from IO18 talks, hands-on learning with Google experts and code labs. Register here https://goo.gl/x83U5E to confirm your attendance

• What to bring
Laptops, Pens and notebooks

• Important to know
Free Entrance

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Makerere
events.description:
Learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices at s study Jam hosted by GDG Makerere

WHY?
Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course. Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

Join GDG Kampala for a 3 day Flutter Study Jam (30th Aug, 4th Sep and 6th Sep 2018) from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm. Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

WHO?
Flutter Study Jam is suited best for: 1) those just getting started with mobile app development 2) those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

Requirements:
The laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.

events.name: DevFest 2018 Makerere
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conferences. Be sure to join us for community-run events that can offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, hack-a-thons, codelabs, and more.

Save the Date 1st December from 8:30 pm to 4:00 pm in Kampala for a chance to experience speaker sessions and codelabs while networking for great opportunities.

Topics to be covered Inlcude:
i) AI and Cloud,
ii) Web and Android technologies.

Requirements:
i) Those who would like to get their hands dirty with code are advised to carry a laptop.
ii) It is advisable to come with a team if you would want to participate in a hackathon.

Please fill the form linked https://goo.gl/w5PBYQ to give your details and expectations (Highly recommended).

events.name: Cloud Study Jam 2019
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console and IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

AGENDA
08:30am Welcome!
09:00am Get free access to Qwiklabs
09:10am Lab 1: Introduction to Internet of Things with Qwiklabs
09:45am Lab 2: A tour of IoT Core
11:15am Break
11:30am Lab 3: Streaming IoT Data to Google Cloud Storage.
12:30pm Event ends - THANK YOU!

events.name: IWD Uganda
events.description:
International Womens Day (IWD) 2019 aims on innovative ways in which we can advance gender equality and the empowerment of women, particularly in areas of social protection systems, access to public services and sustainable infrastructures. It is against this background to borrow and integrate approaches and new solutions in addressing women most pressing issues towards protection and particularly when it comes to advancing gender equality and empowerment of women and girls in today’s changing world of tech work. Innovation and technology are providing unprecedented opportunities yet trends and data indicate a growing gender digital divide gap in Science , Technology , Engineering and Mathematics (STEM). This is preventing many from developing and influencing gender responsive innovations to achieve trans-formative gains in society.

IWD Uganda aims to contribute towards to the theme “THINK EQUAL, BUILD SMART, INNOVATE FOR CHANGE" to raise awareness of innovative women leaders in technology and inspire others to join the technology field to bridge the gender digital divide gap. We will show case innovate technology leaders who are designing and building smart tools in the fight to end all forms of violence against women and girls.

IWD 2019 will have discussions involving industry leaders, game changing startups, social entrepreneurs, gender equality activists, innovator and women Techmakers to examine the ways in which innovation can remove barriers accelerate progress for women and girls pursuing in STEM careers.

International Women’s Day March 8, is a day to celebrate the achievements of women while calling for greater equality within our communities. Join us on 2nd March for IWD Uganda as we plan to improve our programs thus increasing women GDG members through increased collaboration and raising awareness through STEM programs country wide.

events.name: Cloud StudyJam 2019 (2 of 4)
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console and IoT on Cloud and GCP Essentials. Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home.

Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.
